snippet: The sophistication of their online fund-raising efforts is giving Democrats — and Senator Bernie Sanders in particular — an edge in courting small donors.
abstract: Republican presidential candidates lag behind Democrats in reaching small donors through online platforms; ActBlue, nonprofit raising money for Democratic presidential candidates online, has earned almost 74 percent of $26 million that Bernie Sanders raised, most of which came through small donations of $200 or less.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and NICK CORASANITI
byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau reported from Somerville, and Nick Corasaniti from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The sophistication of their online fund-raising efforts is giving Democrats — and Senator Bernie Sanders in particular — an edge in courting small donors.

headline.main: Small Donors Are Clicking More With Democrats Than Republicans
headline.print_headline: Small Donors Are Clicking More With Democrats Than Republicans
